snippet: The damage caused by influence-seeking campaign money unleashed by recent Supreme Court rulings is spreading to state judicial elections.
abstract: Editorial criticizes West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals ruling that denied matching funds under state's pilot campaign financing program for judicial races to Republican candidate Allen Loughry II; contends ruling shows how damage caused by enormous amounts of influence-seeking campaign money unleashed by recent Supreme Court rulings is spreading to state judicial elections.
lead_paragraph: The damage caused by influence-seeking campaign money unleashed by recent Supreme Court rulings is spreading to state judicial elections.
